HDG.IM.content: many (essential) words [transcendental signifier] are worn out, used up, abused—language in general is used up, masterless, as indifferent as means of public transportation [social media]

HDG.IM.linkedContent: w/out Being: no language at all, no single word [transcendental signifier]

HDG.IM.content: word & meaning are bound > “Being itself relies on word in a totally different and more essential sense than any being does” [transcendental signifier, value?]
HDG.IM.linkedContent: word & meaning are bound > “Being itself relies on word in a totally different and more essential sense than any being does” [transcendental signifier, value?]

HDG.BC.content: guidewords (Leitworte) > being is emptiest at same time surplus (Überfluss) > “is” indicates emptiness (Leere) (reflection [Nachdenken] can find no support [Anhalt]) & wealth (Reichtum) w/in which Being of beings pronounces (ausspricht) itself > w/ “is,” a surplus put into words [is this different w/ any other word? transcendental signifier]

motif.name: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

HDG.BC.linkedContent: guidewords (Leitworte) > being is emptiest at same time surplus (Überfluss) > “is” indicates emptiness (Leere) (reflection [Nachdenken] can find no support [Anhalt]) & wealth (Reichtum) w/in which Being of beings pronounces (ausspricht) itself > w/ “is,” a surplus put into words [is this different w/ any other word? transcendental signifier]

HDG.FS.content: “reflection,” Latin re-flexere, turning-back upon itself (zurückzuwenden), towards the ego > in Descartes, ego, as cogitans, appears as cogitatum, object > in Kant’s language: “it must be possible for the I think to accompany all my representations” > transcendental apperception re: finite essence of man > Hegel absolutizes finite understanding, brings power of conjoining to absolute power: “what is finite w/ man becomes the infinite Absolute” > infinite as sublation of finite

HDG.FS.linkedContent: “reflection,” Latin re-flexere, turning-back upon itself (zurückzuwenden), towards the ego > in Descartes, ego, as cogitans, appears as cogitatum, object > in Kant’s language: “it must be possible for the I think to accompany all my representations” > transcendental apperception re: finite essence of man > Hegel absolutizes finite understanding, brings power of conjoining to absolute power: “what is finite w/ man becomes the infinite Absolute” > infinite as sublation of finite

HDG.FS.content: formal logic foundation of transcendental logic? or vice versa? > difference/relation btwn formal Logic/transcendental Logic = difference/relation btwn ordinary principle/speculative principle (Satz) [on difficulty of determining highest principle in Fichte, that of identity or that of positing non-Ego?]
HDG.FS.linkedContent: formal logic foundation of transcendental logic? or vice versa? > difference/relation btwn formal Logic/transcendental Logic = difference/relation btwn ordinary principle/speculative principle (Satz) [on difficulty of determining highest principle in Fichte, that of identity or that of positing non-Ego?]

HDG.CCP.content: transcendental horizonal re-presenting, horizon/transcendence go/pass beyond object, but only relative to object > horizon still something else besides horizon (beyond its appearance as horizon of our representing), this something else is other side of itself, so same as itself

HDG.CCP.content: being released from our transcendental relation is 1st aspect of releasement [destruction 1st, but then what?] > but an authentic Gelassenheit wouldn’t necessarily be preceded by this release (from horizontal transcendence)
HDG.CCP.linkedContent: being released from our transcendental relation is 1st aspect of releasement [destruction 1st, but then what?] > but an authentic Gelassenheit wouldn’t necessarily be preceded by this release (from horizontal transcendence)

HDG.CCP.content: as release from transcendental re-presentation, Gelassenheit is a relinquishing of the willing of a horizon > this relinquishing doesn’t stem from a willing, except the occasion for releasing oneself to Gegnet “requires a trace of willing” > this trace vanishes while releasing oneself & is completely extinguished in Gelassenheit [annihilation of trace or absolute ash?]
HDG.CCP.linkedContent: as release from transcendental re-presentation, Gelassenheit is a relinquishing of the willing of a horizon > this relinquishing doesn’t stem from a willing, except the occasion for releasing oneself to Gegnet “requires a trace of willing” > this trace vanishes while releasing oneself & is completely extinguished in Gelassenheit [annihilation of trace or absolute ash?]

HDG.OHF.content: Heidegger describes how transcendental idealism entered phenomenology [via Dilthey?] &, as a countermovement, traditional realism > no one asked whether epistemological questions are meaningless in phenomenology
